headline.main: ROME SPURNS SAFETY OF OPEN-CITY STATUS; Reply, Linked to Mussolini, Balks at Allied "Humiliation"

lead_paragraph: BERNE, Switzerland ,July 1 -- Rome will not be declared an open city, according to an unsigned editorial in today's Popolo d'Italia, attributable by its style to Premier Mussolini.
abstract: unsigned ed in Milan Popolo d'Italia attributed to Mussolini spurns open-city status for Rome
snippet: BERNE, Switzerland ,July 1 -- Rome will not be declared an open city, according to an unsigned editorial in today's Popolo d'Italia, attributable by its style to Premier Mussolini....

byline.original: By Telephone to THE NEW YORK TIMES
